comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: F-8 Crusader with ‘C0323’ on base of tail, MARINES on lower rear fuselage, tail code WS and side number 1 on nose. From known Crusader production batches, ‘0323’ corresponds with F-8E Crusader 150323. An explanation for the prefix letter ‘C’ and squadron identity may be found on this internet website: (find color profile with caption below to view) wp.scn.ru/en/forum/in_focus/812-3-12 wp.scn.ru/en/ww3/f/812/3/16 Serial: 1/WS (BuNo.150323) Unit: VMF(AW)-323 "Death Rattlers", USMC MCAS El Toro, circa 1963. The Commanding Officer (CO) of Marine All-Weather Fighter Squadron Three Twenty Three - VMF(AW)-323 - 'Death Rattlers' flew this F-8E (F8U-2NE) (WS-1/BuNo 150323). The letter 'C' was painted before the four-digit abbreviated Bureau Number (BuNo) on the tail, which made this appear to say CO323 (Commander of 323). 1963 picture of F-8E 150323 with VMF(AW)-323 ‘Death Rattlers’ over NAS Atsugi Japan may be found on this website, exactly as pictured above: geta-o.maxs.jp/USMIL/F/F-8/F-8E/F8E.htm geta-o.maxs.jp/USMIL/F/F-8/F-8E/150323(ws1)f-8e-0192.jpg VMF (AW) -323 "Death Rattlers" 150323/WS-1 1963 Then brand new F-8E 150323 was part of forward based VMF(AW)-323 as side number 1 code WS at NAS Atsugi during 1963-1964 with Marine Aircraft Group Eleven (MAG-11): www.gonavy.jp/usmc/51/usmc5102.html F-8E 150323 was transferred to forward based VMF(AW)-122 as side number 8 code DC at NAS Atsugi during 1964-1965 with Marine Aircraft Group Eleven (MAG-11): www.gonavy.jp/usmc/51/usmc5102b.html (all ‘GO!NAVY info courtesy of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan) After this F-8E 150323 was transferred back to America to join US Navy squadron VF-53 ‘Iron Angels’. 1966 picture of F-8E 150323 with VF-53 ‘Iron Angels’ painted as the designated aircraft of the commander of the air wing that was assigned to the aircraft carrier. (CAG; Commander, Air Group -- from the earlier term for an Air Wing) It was also a standard squadron asset flown by VF-53 pilots. may be viewed here: (scroll down to page 77 using slider bar on right of PDF document with download option) es.scribd.com/doc/60152224/Vought-s-F-8-Crusader-Navy-Fig... VF-53 CAG bird, F-8E 150323 repainted for the 1967 cruise aboard Hancock on 19-7-66. This excellent website and its web pages is an aid to identify units, deployments or if fortunate, individual aircraft: www.gonavy.jp/index.html ‘GO!NAVY’ (courtesy of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval aviation historian) And these web pages: www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NF1f.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW5-NF1967.html records that F-8E 150323 as Modex 200 of VF-53 ‘Iron Angels’ was part of Carrier Air Wing Five (CVW-5) code NF to CVA-19 USS Hancock on Vietnam War deployments to the South China Sea and Tonkin Gulf from January 5 to July 22 1967. F-8E Crusader 150323 was chosen as an alternative subject for a 1/72 scale model kit: www.flevoaviationhobby.net/images/kitreviews/1-72/has253/... Hasegawa F-8E Crusader "Double Nuts" 253 Decal option 1: F-8E, 150323, NF00, VF-53, US Navy, USS Hancock, September 1966. Colorful and heavily armed 1/72 scale model of F-8E Crusader 150323: www.usns.biz/projects-mainmenu-9/erich-j-blaickner-mainme... Ling-Temco-Vought F-8E Crusader USN 1968 Scale 1:72 VF-53; Code. 00 NF BuNo. 150323 Scale 1:72 USS Hancock „COMATAIRWINGFIVE“ Armament: 4x 2cm MK, 8x AGM Zuni, 10 x 250kg GP Mk82 Snakeye Erich J. Blaickner F-8E Crusader 150323 was also chosen as a subject for a 1/48 scale decal set: modelingmadness.com/scotts/decals/super/ss48865.htm Superscale Decals 48-865 Chance Vought F-8E Crusader 150323 NF/00 VF-53 CAG plane CVW-5 USS Hancock 1/48 Originally designated F8U-2NE Crusader, when production aircraft began arriving from September 1962, they were all redesignated F-8E. 286 F-8Es were built, last example rolled off production line summer 1964. www.joebaugher.com/navy_fighters/f8_7.html F-8J 150323 was one of 138 F-8E rebuilt as F-8J: www.joebaugher.com/navy_fighters/f8_12.html F8U-2NE /F-8E/F-8J info courtesy Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago Illinois 1973 picture of F-8J 150323 without markings at NAS Atsugi Japan alongside an EKA-3B Skywarrior may be found with following caption:: F-8J 150323 (Jul.26, 1973) MACH3 No.137 www.gonavy.jp/bbs2-f8.html www.gonavy.jp/bbs1/img/137.jpg F-8E 150323 was retired to the then MASDC on 10 March 1976, receiving inventory code AN2F0378. Formerly of VF-191, as Modex 104, code NM. Taken from there on 12 July 1982 to Indian Springs Air Force Auxiliary Field Nevada for their target range. (now closely associated with Creech Air Force Base)
